snippet: Audrey Flack, 84, a contemporary of notables like Jackson Pollock and Willem de Kooning, is creating new works and shaping a memoir, resisting the urge to retreat full time to her banjo.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column profiles Audrey Flack, noted painter, sculptor and amateur musician who is continuing to create new works in wake of her 84th birthday; observes that Flack is one of few surviving members of generation of artists that included Jackson Pollock and Willem de Kooning; notes that exhibition of her work is currently on view at Hollis Taggart Galleries in Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: Audrey Flack, 84, a contemporary of notables like Jackson Pollock and Willem de Kooning, is creating new works and shaping a memoir, resisting the urge to retreat full time to her banjo.

headline.print_headline: An Artist’s Thoughts of Retirement, Quieted by the Constant Churn of Creativity
headline.main: An Artist With Too Many Ideas to Consider Retiring
